page.title: 03Cadburys Chocolate Factory
page.content: The Marlbrook factory is{one of four which together manufacture{Cadbury's {chocolate.This factory makes}material called{Chocolate Crumb.}Fresh milk is collected daily in special tankers from 500 dairy farms covering 1000 square miles.Daily intake is 100,000 gallons.The milk is evaporated and mixed with white sugar.This produces concentrated milk,which is mixed with warm,liquid cocoa.The resulting paste is dried in a special drying tower. This paste in slab form is broken into half inch chunks.It is called Crumb.15 special{tankers convey}the {crumb to}the{Bournville factory}where the{final products are manufactured. 160 people work a 3 shift system at {Marlbrook works 365 days every year {producing 65,000 tons of crumb a year. As a food factory,hygiene is paramount {A special effluent plant removes waste
